facts.text: In 1928, Pentapati Venkataramana filed Original Suit No. 3 of 1928 in the Court of the Subordinate Judge, Visakhapatnam, against 29 defendants for accounts of dissolved partnerships and recovery of amounts due.
On March 30, 1932, the suit was dismissed by the Subordinate Judge.
On appeal, the High Court of Madras set aside the decree and passed a joint and several decree on September 22, 1938, in favour of the plaintiffs and defendants 24 to 27 for Rs. 54,350 with interest.
On February 15, 1939, decree-holders filed E.P. No. 13 of 1939 for realization by attachment and sale of 31 items of properties.
Judgment-debtors objected to attachment of some items; objection dismissed. Judgment-debtors appealed in C.M.A. No. 26 of 1944; High Court granted interim stay of E.P. 13/1939.
Judgment-debtors filed E.A. No. 575 of 1945 alleging adjustment of decree; dismissed on December 12, 1945. Appeal to High Court with interim stay.
On September 9, 1947, High Court allowed appeal and remanded to trial court to ascertain adjustment.
On remand, executing court dismissed judgment-debtors' application again.
Judgment-debtors appealed in C.M.A. No. 127 of 1948; interim stay obtained, made absolute on November 24, 1948.
Due to High Court stay, executing court closed E.P. 13/1939 on December 28, 1948.
On July 31, 1951, High Court dismissed C.M.A. 127/1948.
On January 21, 1952, decree-holders filed E.A. No. 142/1952 to reopen E.P. 13/1939. Subordinate Judge held previous E.P. merely closed and directed filing regular E.P.
On October 11, 1952 (per order dated October 4, 1952), decree-holders filed E.P. No. 58 of 1953 to continue E.P. 13/1939, praying for sale of properties from draft proclamation in E.P. 13/1939.
Judgment-debtors filed counter-affidavit claiming E.P. 58/1953 barred under s. 48 CPC as fresh application more than 12 years after decree.
Subordinate Judge held E.P. 58/1953 a fresh application, barred by limitation.
On appeal, Andhra Pradesh High Court held E.P. 13/1939 merely closed for statistical purposes, still pending; remanded for other contentions.

legal_issues.text: Whether E.P. No. 58 of 1953 is a fresh application within the meaning of s. 48 of the Code of Civil Procedure, barred by 12-year limitation.

petitioner_arguments.text: The previous execution petition E.P. 13/1939 was dismissed and therefore not pending; E.P. 58/1953 is a fresh application under s. 48 CPC.
Even if previous application closed for statistical purposes, E.P. 58/1953 is fresh because parties and properties proceeded against are different, and relief asked for different.
Court has no power under CPC to close execution for statistical purposes; such order deemed dismissal under O. XXI r. 57 CPC.

court_reasoning.text: E.P. 13/1939 was closed for statistical purposes due to High Court stay, not dismissed; intention was to keep pending, not finally dispose.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Phraseology not decisive; substance and circumstances show proceedings pending.

court_reasoning.text: Practice of closing for statistical purposes condemned but order cannot be treated as dismissal if intention manifestly to keep pending.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Whether valid or not, execution petition remains pending.

court_reasoning.text: E.P. 58/1953 not fresh: parties substantially same (legal reps added), properties subset of previous, no new reliefs; application to continue pending E.P.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Decree-holders not compelled to proceed against all prior properties.

court_reasoning.text: s. 48 targets fresh substantive applications, not to revive/continue pending ones; prior precedents confirm fresh if new parties/properties/reliefs post-12 years.
court_reasoning.key_observation: E.A. 142/1952 expressly sought reopening of pending E.P.

holdings.text: Closing E.P. for statistical purposes due to stay does not amount to dismissal; proceedings remain pending.
E.P. 58/1953 is not a fresh application under s. 48 CPC but continuation of pending E.P. 13/1939; not barred by limitation.

precedents_cited.case_name: Biswa Sonan Chunder Gossyamy v. Binanda Chunder Dibingar Adhikar Gossyamy
precedents_cited.relevance: Condemned practice of closing execution petitions for statistical purposes.

precedents_cited.case_name: Vadlamannati Damodara Rao v. The Official Receiver, Kistna
precedents_cited.relevance: Condemned practice of closing execution petitions for statistical purposes.
Condemned practice of closing execution petitions for statistical purposes.

precedents_cited.case_name: Bandhu Singh v. Kayastha Trading Bank
precedents_cited.relevance: Application including new properties after 12 years is fresh under s. 48.

precedents_cited.case_name: Sri Raja D. K. Venkata Lingama Nayanim v. Raja Inuganti Rajagopala Venkata Narasimha Rayanim
precedents_cited.relevance: Amendment to attach new property after 12 years not allowed under s. 48.

precedents_cited.case_name: Ippagunta Lakshminarasinga Rao v. Ippagunta Balasubrahmanyam
precedents_cited.relevance: Execution petition after 12 years seeking new relief barred by s. 48.
Substitution of new property after 12 years not allowed under s. 48.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure, 1908
statutes_cited.relevance: s. 48 bars fresh execution applications after 12 years; rules govern disposal/closure of executions.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure, 1882
statutes_cited.relevance: Predecessor to s. 48 CPC 1908; compared to clarify 'fresh application'.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed; High Court order upheld. E.P. 13/1939 held pending, E.P. 58/1953 a continuation not barred by s. 48 CPC. Case remanded to Subordinate Judge for disposal per law.
outcome.relief_granted: Decree-holders entitled to proceed with execution via E.P. 58/1953 as continuation.

key_quotes.text: "It is not the phraseology used by the executing court that really matters, but it is really the substance of the order that is material."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Determines if closure meant final dismissal or pending status.

key_quotes.text: "The question, therefore, is whether E.P. 58 of 1953 is a fresh application within the meaning of s. 48 of the Code."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "In the result, we hold that the order of the High Court is right."
key_quotes.speaker: court
